benchmark_details.name: Corpus-informed Retrieval Augmented Generation of Clarifying Questions
benchmark_details.overview: This study aims to develop models that generate corpus informed clarifying questions for web search, ensuring the questions align with the available information in the retrieval corpus. The paper addresses challenges in current datasets and proposes methods for augmenting them to support better clarifying question generation.

data.annotation: Crowdsourced for clarifying questions and intents based on search system usage.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on comparing generated facets to ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: High scores indicate better alignment of generated clarifying questions with users' intents.
methodology.baseline_results: Various models compared including BART and state-of-the-art ensemble methods.
methodology.validation: Results validated through comparative analysis against existing benchmarks.
